attributes.action: ensure minimum standards of noise insulation on new-build properties
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It causes massive amounts of stress and endless costs in call-outs for the police and environmental health officers to attend complaints of noise nuisance which are the no. 1 cause of neighbour disputes. 

It would save masses of public money and lead to happier communities if builders were required to install mimimum levels of sound insulation on new-build properties, particularly attached dwelling such as flats and terraced and semi-detached properties.

No-one expects properties to be soundproof, but it should be possible to watch TV, vacuum and play music at a reasonable volume without it being excessively noisy next door. Too many modern new-built properties have paper-thin walls.

This needn't add too much to the cost of properties - there are already minimum standards for heat insulation and noise insulation can be done quite cheaply if it is designed into the building from the start.
